comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Yes, you must have checked the "Show most recent posts at the top" in your profile. You can disable it by unchecking that option.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Posts are sorted correctly. It's the time displayed on your image that is wrong. For example, NotATether's post has been made on September 19, 2023, 10:45:22 AM (UTC), not Today at 10:45:22 AM.Check the first page of thread once again and if the times are not shown correctly, do a hard refresh (CTRL+F5). It seems that you are seeing an old version of the webpage.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I expect you captured the screen on the first page before the page refreshed and when you moved to the next page the time became refreshed and that's it.This is not a technical problem. This may happen sometimes due to the page not being refreshed or an error in the timing of the computer or mobile.Most of the time I leave the forum page open in the browser and close the computer and when I later turn on the browser the old page appears with the previous time when I close. I have to refresh the page to get the correct updated page.
